entry.title: Le Corricolo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Alexandre Dumas's travel book Le Corricolo, published in 1843, contains one of the earliest literary accounts of Neapolitan pizza (pizza maker pictured)?

entry.title: Narita Viliamu Tahega (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Narita Viliamu Tahega has won 38 medals in international weightlifting competitions, the most in the history of Niue athletics?

entry.title: Night Watchman (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Canadian Night Watchman was the first operational radar system in North America?

entry.title: John Goldmark (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John Goldmark brought a libel suit that did "to the Red Scare what the Scopes monkey trial had ... done to Creationism"?

entry.title: Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, Taiyuan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that during the Boxer Rebellion in 1900, Boxer rebels destroyed the Cathedral of the Immaculate Conception, Taiyuan, and 26 members of the clergy were killed?

entry.title: Meron Estefanos (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Toronto Star estimated that Meron Estefanos may have helped save 16,000 refugees with her phone?

entry.title: killing of Fausto and Iaio (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that although four far-right groups claimed responsibility for the killing of Fausto and Iaio, no one was convicted of the crime?

entry.title: Talking to Yourself (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Consequence selected Carly Rae Jepsen's "Talking to Yourself" as song of the week and declared her music speaks for the "delightfully unhinged"?
